SortOrder.description: Indicates that the column is sorted in ascending order ( `== 1` ), or in descending order ( `==0` ).

Order.description: Specifies the sort order of a sorted column.

Parameters.description: These key-value pairs define partition parameters.

StorageDescriptor.description: Provides information about the physical location where the partition is stored.

Values.description:
The values of the partition. Although this parameter is not required by the SDK, you must specify this parameter for a valid input.

The values for the keys for the new partition must be passed as an array of String objects that must be ordered in the same order as the partition keys appearing in the Amazon S3 prefix. Otherwise AWS Glue will add the values to the wrong keys.

PartitionInput.description: The structure used to create and update a partition.

RegistryName.description: The name of the schema registry that contains the schema.

SchemaArn.description:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema. One of `SchemaArn` or `SchemaName` has to be
provided.

SchemaName.description: The name of the schema. One of `SchemaArn` or `SchemaName` has to be provided.

SchemaId.description:
A structure that contains schema identity fields. Either this or the `SchemaVersionId` has to be
provided.

A structure that contains schema identity fields. Either this or the `SchemaVersionId` has to be
provided.

SchemaVersionId.description: The unique ID assigned to a version of the schema. Either this or the `SchemaId` has to be provided.

SchemaVersionNumber.description: The version number of the schema.

SchemaReference.description: An object that references a schema stored in the AWS Glue Schema Registry.

Parameters.description: These key-value pairs define initialization parameters for the SerDe.

SerializationLibrary.description: Usually the class that implements the SerDe. An example is `org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.columnar.ColumnarSerDe` .

SerdeInfo.description: Information about a serialization/deserialization program (SerDe) that serves as an extractor and loader.

SkewedColumnNames.description: A list of names of columns that contain skewed values.

SkewedColumnValueLocationMaps.description: A mapping of skewed values to the columns that contain them.

SkewedColumnValues.description: A list of values that appear so frequently as to be considered skewed.

SkewedInfo.description: Specifies skewed values in a table. Skewed values are those that occur with very high frequency.

BucketColumns.description: A list of reducer grouping columns, clustering columns, and bucketing columns in the table.

Columns.description: A list of the `Columns` in the table.

Compressed.description: `True` if the data in the table is compressed, or `False` if not.

InputFormat.description: The input format: `SequenceFileInputFormat` (binary), or `TextInputFormat` , or a custom format.

Location.description: The physical location of the table. By default, this takes the form of the warehouse location, followed by the database location in the warehouse, followed by the table name.

NumberOfBuckets.description:
The number of buckets.

You must specify this property if the partition contains any dimension columns.

OutputFormat.description: The output format: `SequenceFileOutputFormat` (binary), or `IgnoreKeyTextOutputFormat` , or a custom format.

Parameters.description: The user-supplied properties in key-value form.

SchemaReference.description: An object that references a schema stored in the AWS Glue Schema Registry.

SkewedInfo.description: The information about values that appear frequently in a column (skewed values).

SortColumns.description: A list specifying the sort order of each bucket in the table.

StoredAsSubDirectories.description: `True` if the table data is stored in subdirectories, or `False` if not.

StorageDescriptor.description: Describes the physical storage of table data.

description: The `AWS::Glue::Partition` resource creates an AWS Glue partition, which represents a slice of table data. For more information, see [CreatePartition Action](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/glue/latest/dg/aws-glue-api-catalog-partitions.html#aws-glue-api-catalog-partitions-CreatePartition) and [Partition Structure](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/glue/latest/dg/aws-glue-api-catalog-partitions.html#aws-glue-api-catalog-partitions-Partition) in the *AWS Glue Developer Guide* .

CatalogId.description:
The AWS account ID of the catalog in which the partion is to be created.

> To specify the account ID, you can use the `Ref` intrinsic function with the `AWS::AccountId` pseudo parameter. For example: `!Ref AWS::AccountId`

DatabaseName.description: The name of the catalog database in which to create the partition.

PartitionInput.description: The structure used to create and update a partition.

TableName.description: The name of the metadata table in which the partition is to be created.
